articles.title: Mystery child hepatitis cases linked to previously 'harmless' virus
articles.description: Two studies have linked the mysterious rise in unexplained hepatitis cases among children to the adeno-associated virus 2, which infects nearly everyone early in childhood
articles.content:

An adeno-associated virus 2 capsid
LAGUNA DESIGN/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY

articles.title: Long covid symptoms may include hair loss and ejaculation difficulties
articles.description: A study of 2.4 million health records suggests the World Health Organization's set of 33 long covid symptoms may be too limited
articles.content:
By Carissa Wong
Hair loss may be a long covid symptom
Adem Demir / Alamy
Hair loss, reduced libido and ejaculation difficulties may be unrecognised symptoms of long covid, according to a study of … [+3980 chars]

articles.title: Even 'net zero' aviation could still cause significant global warming
articles.description: Not accounting for aviation’s non-CO2 effects such as contrails could ignore 90 per cent of future flights’ contribution to climate change
articles.content:

articles.title: Avalanches may be caused by earthquake-like shifts in snow
articles.description: A computer simulation found that some avalanches are caused by snow fracturing in a way similar to how fault planes slide in earthquakes
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
Some avalanches may have similarities to earthquakes
Fedor Selivanov/Shutterstock
Avalanches may happen when layers of snow crack and slide in a way similar to a type … [+2400 chars]

articles.title: Controversial idea that T. rex was three species comes under fire
articles.description: A study that proposed Tyrannosaurus rex is three separate dinosaur species has been strongly disputed by another group of researchers, who say there was just one iconic tyrant lizard king
articles.content:
By Carissa Wong
Variation in Tyrannosaurus rex fossils has led some to suggest that ithey aren’t all from the same species

articles.title: Air pollution likely to be causing dementia, say UK science advisers

articles.title: JWST finds galaxies may adopt Milky Way-like shape faster than thought
articles.description: Astronomers thought that galaxies in the early universe would mostly be shapeless blobs, but an analysis of data from the James Webb Space Telescope suggests around half are disc-shaped like the Milky Way
articles.content:
By Will Gater
The shape of galaxies in JWST’s deep field image are surprising astronomers

articles.title: Monkeypox has become a global health emergency, says WHO
articles.description: The World Health Organization has declared the spread of monkeypox to be a "public health emergency of international concern", its highest alert level

articles.title: Hibernating beetles break down and regrow their muscles on demand
articles.description: Colorado potato beetles lose almost all the mitochondria in their muscles during hibernation, but regrow them in time to start flying in the spring
articles.content:

A Colorado potato beetle
Jose B. Ruiz/naturepl.com

articles.title: Sticklebacks may pass information learned from other fish to offspring
articles.description: Stickleback fish can learn about predators by observing their peers. They may then be able to pass that information onto their offspring – without ever interacting with them
articles.content:
